Those of you working in or near the geospatial domain might be  
interested=
 in a REST-related RFC:

http://www.opengeospatial.org/standards/requests/5=
4

"""
The membership of the Open Geospatial Consortium, Inc. (OGC=AE) is  =

requesting comments from the public on the candidate OpenGIS=AE Web Map  
=
Tiling Service (WMTS) Interface Standard.

The candidate WMTS Interface Sta=
ndard is much like the OGC's popular  
Web Map Server (WMS) Interface Stand=
ard, but it enables better server  
performance in applications that involv=
e many simultaneous requests.  
To improve performance, instead of creating=
 a new image for each  
request, it returns small pre-generated images (e.g=
., PNG or JPEG) or  
reuses identical previous requests that follow a discr=
ete set of tile  
matrices. This proposed standard provides support for mul=
tiple  
architectural patterns - KVP, REST and SOAP.
"""

The authors propo=
se REST bindings to complement HTTP RPC and SOAP  
bindings. IMO, it needs =
a little work, which I hope the authors can be  
convinced to do as this st=
andard will more or less define REST in the  
GIS mainstream.

--
Sean Gill=
ies
Software Engineer
Institute for the Study of the Ancient World
New York=
 University
